results.name: This table shows the coefficients of combinatorial formulas needed for generating the sequential sums of p-th powers of binomial coefficients C(n,7). The p-th row (p>=1) contains a(i,p) for i=1 to 7*p-6, where a(i,p) satisfies Sum_{i=1..n} C(i+6,7)^p = 8 * C(n+7,8) * Sum_{i=1..7*p-6} a(i,p) * C(n-1,i-1)/(i+7).
comment: The table entries T(n,k) are the coefficients when expressing the polynomial C(x+7,7)^p of degree 7*p in terms of falling factorials: C(x+7,7)^p = Sum_{k = 0..7*p} T(p,k)*C(x,k). It follows that Sum_{i = 0..n-1} C(i+7,7)^p = Sum_{k = 0..7*p} T(p,k)*C(n,k+1). (End)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 40 rows, flattebed
Dukes, C. D. White, Web Matrices: Structural Properties and Generating Combinatorial Identities, arXiv:1603.01589 [math.CO], 2016.
formula: The following remarks assume the row and column indices start at 0.

T(n,k) = Sum_{i = 0..k} (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k,i) * binomial(i+7,7)^n. Equivalently, let v_n denote the sequence (1, 8^n, 36^n, 120^n, ...) regarded as an infinite column vector, where 1, 8, 36, 120, ... is the sequence binomial(n+7,7) - see A000580. Then the n-th row of this table is determined by the matrix product P^(-1)*v_n, where P denotes Pascal's triangle A007318.
Recurrence: T(n+1,k) = Sum_{i = 0..7} C(7,i)*C(k+7-i,7)*T(n,k-i) with boundary conditions T(n,0) = 1 for all n and T(n,k) = 0 for k > 7*n.
n-th row polynomial R(n,x) = (1 + x)^7 o (1 + x)^7 o ... o (1 + x)^7 (n factors), where o denotes the black diamond product of power series defined in Dukes and White.
maple: seq(seq(add( (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k, i)*binomial(i+7, 7)^n, i = 0..k), k = 0..7*n), n = 0..4); # _Peter Bala_, Mar 11 2018
program: (PARI) {a(i, p) = sum(k=1, (2*i + 1 + (-1)^(i - 1))/4, binomial(i - 1, 2*k - 2)*binomial(i - 2*k + 8, i - 2*k + 1)^(p - 1) - binomial(i - 1, 2*k - 1)*binomial(i - 2*k + 7, i - 2*k)^(p - 1))}; for(p=1,8, for(i=1, 7*p-6, print1(if(p==1,1,a(i,p)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 23 2017
